intro: Vicia heterophylla f. platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved vetch, is a horticultural form of the common vetch. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. This plant is typically found in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The foliage and flowers are edible, making it a versatile plant for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
